page.title: 10NOVEMBER IN LONGTON
page.content: The Round Table bonfire and fire- work display is held on the Saturday nearest to{November 5th.}First the bonfire is lit at 6.30pm.There is a dummy Guy Fawkes on the top to be ceremoniously burned. The fireworks begin at 7.00pm. with a large, loud rocket. The fireworks last about 30 minutes then the crowd visit stalls to buy hot dogs and soup to warm up again The Scouts organise a Remembrance Day Parade on the Sunday nearest to {November 11th.}The Parade of uniformed organisations and Councillors marches to the War Memorial outside St Oswalds Church to lay wreaths of poppies, then marches to St. Andrew's Church for a Service which includes a two minute silence and the playing of the Last Post on the bugles. The names of villagers killed in the two World Wars are read out by the Church Wardens.
